title: Learner-Centered Mathematics Education Design: Integrated Personalized, Project-Based, and Self-Directed Curriculum

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical theory and practical application experience
context.additional_context: Provides flexible learning environments utilizing digital devices alongside work-integrated project implementation for current practitioners

learning_goals: Learners achieve over 80% proficiency in applying mathematical concepts by designing individualized learning pathways.

In teams of 4–6, learners will select one real-world problem from public/nonprofit sectors (e.g., budget reduction, process efficiency) and submit a report (10 pages) and presentation (15 slides PPT) after a six-week project, achieving ≥4 points (out of 5) in four of the five evaluation criteria (problem definition clarity, solution creativity, feasibility).
Learners analyze and adjust their learning outcomes at least twice monthly using self-directed learning strategies.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
